page.title: 16Tin Mining at Clearbrook
page.content: {Clearbrook}was once a mining village,most of the miners lived there.The houses that they used to live in still stand to this day.In the 1920's the houses were changed from oil lamps to using electricity.The houses are very small,the doors and windows are tiny because the people used to be smaller.At first the mine was a {Copper Mine} until the copper ran out,then it changed to{Tin.}There could still be some old miners living in{Clearbrook}.Most houses in { {Clearbrook}are modern now,but the older miners cottages still survive.There is a Pub called {The {Skylark},in 1790 it was a barn and then it was turned into an Ale House so that the{Tin Miners}could go somewhere for a drink.
